1.verse: THE LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai in the Tent of Meeting on the first day of the second month in the second year after they came out of the land of Egypt, saying,

2.verse: Take a census of all the males of the congregation of the Israelites by families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, head by head.

3.verse: From twenty years old and upward, all in Israel who are able to go forth to war you and Aaron shall number, company by company.

4.verse: And with you there shall be a man [to assist you] from each tribe, each being the head of his father's house.

5.verse: And these are the names of the men who shall attend you: Of Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;

6.verse: Of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;

7.verse: Of Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;

8.verse: Of Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;

9.verse: Of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;

10.verse: Of the sons of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;

11.verse: Of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;

12.verse: Of Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;

13.verse: Of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;

14.verse: Of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;

15.verse: Of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.

16.verse: These were those chosen from the congregation, the leaders of their ancestral tribes, heads of thousands [the highest class of officers] in Israel.

17.verse: And Moses and Aaron took these men who have been named,

18.verse: And assembled all the congregation on the first day of the second month, and they declared their ancestry after their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, head by head,

19.verse: As the Lord commanded Moses. So he numbered them in the Wilderness of Sinai.

20.verse: The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go to war:

21.verse: Those of the tribe of Reuben numbered 46,500.

22.verse: Of the sons of Simeon, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, those numbered of them according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go to war:

23.verse: Those of the tribe of Simeon numbered 59,300.

24.verse: Of the sons of Gad, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go to war:

25.verse: Those of the tribe of Gad numbered 45,650.

26.verse: Of the sons of Judah, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

27.verse: Those of the tribe of Judah numbered 74,600.

28.verse: Of the sons of Issachar, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

29.verse: Those of the tribe of Issachar numbered 54,400.

30.verse: Of the sons of Zebulun, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

31.verse: Those of the tribe of Zebulun numbered 57,400.

32.verse: Of the sons of Joseph: the sons of Ephraim, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

33.verse: Those of the tribe of Ephraim numbered 40,500.

34.verse: Of the sons of Manasseh, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

35.verse: Those of the tribe of Manasseh numbered 32,200.

36.verse: Of the sons of Benjamin, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

37.verse: Those of the tribe of Benjamin numbered 35,400.

38.verse: Of the sons of Dan, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

39.verse: Those of the tribe of Dan numbered 62,700.

40.verse: Of the sons of Asher, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

41.verse: Those of the tribe of Asher numbered 41,500.

42.verse: Of the sons of Naphtali, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all able to go to war:

43.verse: Those of the tribe of Naphtali numbered 53,400.

44.verse: These were numbered by Moses and Aaron, and the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each representing his father's house.

45.verse: So all those numbered of the Israelites, by their fathers' houses, from twenty years old and upward, able to go to war in Israel,

47.verse: But the Levites by their fathers' tribe were not numbered with them.

48.verse: For the Lord had said to Moses,

49.verse: Only the tribe of Levi you shall not number in the census of the Israelites.

50.verse: But appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the Testimony, and over all its vessels and furnishings and all things that belong to it. They shall carry the tabernacle [when journeying] and all its furnishings, and they shall minister to it and encamp around it.

51.verse: When the tabernacle is to go forward, the Levites shall take it down, and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up. And the excluded [any not of the tribe of Levi] who approach the tabernacle shall be put to death.

52.verse: The Israelites shall pitch their tents by their companies, every man by his own camp and every man by his own [tribal] standard.

53.verse: But the Levites shall encamp around the tabernacle of the Testimony, that there may be no wrath upon the congregation of the Israelites; and the Levites shall keep charge of the tabernacle of the Testimony.

54.verse: Thus did the Israelites; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so they did.

1.verse: THE LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

2.verse: The Israelites shall encamp, each by his own [tribal] standard or banner with the ensign of his father's house, opposite the Tent of Meeting and facing it on every side.

3.verse: On the east side toward the sunrise shall they of the standard of the camp of Judah encamp by their companies; Nahshon son of Amminadab being the leader of the sons of Judah.

4.verse: Judah's host as numbered totaled 74,600.

5.verse: Next to Judah the tribe of Issachar shall encamp, Nethanel son of Zuar being the leader of the sons of Issachar.

6.verse: Issachar's host as numbered totaled 54,400.

7.verse: Then the tribe of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon being the leader of the sons of Zebulun.

8.verse: Zebulun's host as numbered totaled 57,400.

9.verse: All these [three tribes] numbered in the camp of Judah totaled 186,400. They shall set forth first [on the march].

10.verse: On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben by their companies, the leader of the sons of Reuben being Elizur son of Shedeur.

11.verse: Reuben's host as numbered totaled 46,500.

12.verse: Those who encamp next to Reuben shall be the tribe of Simeon, the leader of the sons of Simeon being Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

13.verse: Simeon's host as numbered totaled 59,300.

14.verse: Then the tribe of Gad, the leader of the sons of Gad being Eliasaph son of Reuel (Deuel).

15.verse: Gad's host as numbered totaled 45,650.

16.verse: The whole number in [the three tribes of] the camp of Reuben was 151,450. They shall take second place [on the march].

17.verse: Then the Tent of Meeting shall set out, with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; as they encamp so shall they set forward, every man in his place, standard after standard.

18.verse: On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim by their companies, the leader of the sons of Ephraim being Elishama son of Ammihud.

19.verse: Ephraim's host as numbered totaled 40,500.

20.verse: Beside Ephraim shall be the tribe of Manasseh, the leader of the sons of Manasseh being Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

21.verse: Manasseh's host as numbered totaled 32,200.

22.verse: Then the tribe of Benjamin, the leader of the sons of Benjamin being Abidan son of Gideoni.

23.verse: Benjamin's host as numbered totaled 35,400.

24.verse: The whole number [of the three tribes] in the camp of Ephraim totaled 108,100. They shall go forward in third place.

25.verse: The standard of the camp of Dan shall be on the north side [of the tabernacle] by their companies, the leader of the sons of Dan being Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

26.verse: Dan's host as numbered totaled 62,700.

27.verse: Encamped next to Dan shall be the tribe of Asher, the leader of the sons of Asher being Pagiel son of Ochran.

28.verse: Asher's host as numbered totaled 41,500.

29.verse: Then the tribe of Naphtali, the leader of the sons of Naphtali being Ahira son of Enan.

30.verse: Naphtali's host as numbered totaled 53,400.

31.verse: The whole number [of the three tribes] in the camp of Dan totaled 157,600. They shall set out last, standard after standard.

32.verse: These are the Israelites as numbered by their fathers' houses. All in the camps who were numbered by their companies were 603,550.

33.verse: But the Levites were not numbered with the Israelites, for so the Lord commanded Moses.

34.verse: Thus the Israelites did according to all the Lord commanded Moses; so they encamped by their standards, and so they set forward, everyone with his [tribal] families, according to his father's house.

1.verse: NOW THESE are the generations of Aaron and Moses when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.

2.verse: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

3.verse: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed, whom Aaron consecrated and ordained to minister in the priest's office.

4.verse: But Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered strange fire before the Lord in the Wilderness of Sinai; and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar ministered in the priest's office in the presence and under the supervision of Aaron their father.

5.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

6.verse: Bring the tribe of Levi near and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.

7.verse: And they shall carry out his instructions and the duties connected with the whole assembly before the Tent of Meeting, doing the service of the tabernacle.

8.verse: And they shall keep all the instruments and furnishings of the Tent of Meeting and take charge of [attending] the Israelites, to serve in the tabernacle.

9.verse: And you shall give the Levites [as servants and helpers] to Aaron and his sons; they are wholly given to him from among the Israelites.

10.verse: And you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall observe and attend to their priest's office; but the excluded [anyone daring to assume priestly duties or privileges who is not of the house of Aaron and called of God] who comes near [the holy things] shall be put to death.

11.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

12.verse: Behold, I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites instead of every firstborn who opens the womb among the Israelites; and the Levites shall be Mine,

13.verse: For all the firstborn are Mine. On the day that I slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated for Myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast; Mine they shall be. I am the Lord.

14.verse: And the Lord said to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai,

15.verse: Number the sons of Levi by their fathers' houses and by families. Every male from a month old and upward you shall number.

16.verse: So Moses numbered them as he was commanded by the word of the Lord.

17.verse: These were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

18.verse: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.

19.verse: The sons of Kohath by their families: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

20.verse: The sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their fathers' houses.

21.verse: Of Gershon were the families of the Libnites and of the Shimeites. These are the families of the Gershonites.

22.verse: The males who were numbered of them from a month old and upward totaled 7,500.

23.verse: The families of the Gershonites were to encamp behind the tabernacle on the west,

24.verse: The leader of the fathers' houses of the Gershonites being Eliasaph son of Lael.

25.verse: And the responsibility of the sons of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting was to be the tabernacle, the tent, its covering, and the hangings for the door of the Tent of Meeting,

26.verse: And the hangings of the court, the curtain for the door of the court which is around the tabernacle and the altar, its cords, and all the service pertaining to them.

27.verse: Of Kohath were the families of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites; these are the families of the Kohathites.

28.verse: The number of all the males from a month old and upward totaled 8,600, attending to the duties of the sanctuary.

29.verse: The families of the sons of Kohath were to encamp on the south side of the tabernacle,

30.verse: The chief of the fathers' houses of the families of the Kohathites being Elizaphan son of Uzziel.

31.verse: Their charge was to be the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, and the utensils of the sanctuary with which the priests minister, and the screen, and all the service having to do with these.

32.verse: Eleazar son of Aaron the priest was to be chief over the leaders of the Levites, and have the oversight of those who had charge of the sanctuary.

33.verse: Of Merari were the families of the Mahlites and the Mushites; these are the families of Merari.

34.verse: Their number of all the males from a month old and upward totaled 6,200.

35.verse: And the head of the fathers' houses of the families of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail; the Merarites were to encamp on the north side of the tabernacle.

36.verse: And the appointed charge of the sons of Merari was the boards or frames of the tabernacle, and its bars, pillars, sockets or bases, and all the accessories or instruments of it, and all the work connected with them,

37.verse: And the pillars of the surrounding court and their sockets or bases, with their pegs and their cords.

38.verse: But those to encamp before the tabernacle toward the east, before the Tent of Meeting, toward the sunrise, were to be Moses and Aaron and his sons, keeping the full charge of the rites of the sanctuary in whatever was required for the Israelites; and the excluded [one not a descendant of Aaron and called of God] who came near [the sanctuary] was to be put to death.

39.verse: All the Levites whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the command of the Lord, by their families, all the males from a month old and upward, were 22,000.

40.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, Number all the firstborn of the males of the Israelites from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

41.verse: You shall take the Levites for Me instead of all the firstborn among the Israelites. I am the Lord; and you shall take the cattle of the Levites for Me instead of all the firstlings among the cattle of the Israelites.

42.verse: So Moses numbered, as the Lord commanded him, all the firstborn Israelites.

43.verse: But all the firstborn males from a month old and upward as numbered were 22,273 [273 more than the Levites].

44.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

45.verse: Take the Levites [for Me] instead of all the firstborn Israelites, and the Levites' cattle instead of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine. I am the Lord.

46.verse: And for those 273 who are to be redeemed of the firstborn of the Israelites who outnumber the Levites,

47.verse: You shall take five shekels apiece, reckoning by the sanctuary shekel of twenty gerahs; you shall collect them,

48.verse: And you shall give the ransom silver from the excess number [over the Levites] to be redeemed to Aaron and his sons.

49.verse: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were left over from the number who were redeemed by the Levites.

50.verse: From the firstborn of the Israelites he took the money, 1,365 shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

51.verse: And Moses gave the money from those who were ransomed to Aaron and his sons, as the Lord commanded Moses.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

2.verse: Take a census of the Kohathite division among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers' houses,

3.verse: From thirty years old and up to fifty years old, all who can enter the service to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

4.verse: This shall be the responsibility of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting: the most holy things.

5.verse: When the camp prepares to set forward, Aaron and his sons shall take down the veil [screening the Holy of Holies] and cover the ark of the Testimony with it,

6.verse: And shall put on it the covering of dolphin or porpoise skin, and shall spread over that a cloth wholly of blue, and shall put in place the poles of the ark.

7.verse: And upon the table of showbread they shall spread a cloth of blue and put on it the plates, the dishes for incense, the bowls, the flagons for the drink offering, and also the continual showbread.

8.verse: And they shall spread over them a cloth of scarlet, and put over that a covering of dolphin or porpoise skin, and put in place the poles [for carrying].

9.verse: And they shall take a cloth of blue and cover the lampstand for the light and its lamps, its snuffers, its ashtrays, and all the oil vessels from which it is supplied.

10.verse: And they shall put the lampstand and all its utensils within a covering of dolphin or porpoise skin and shall put it upon the frame [for carrying].

11.verse: And upon the golden [incense] altar they shall spread a cloth of blue, and cover it with a covering of dolphin or porpoise skin, and shall put in place its poles [for carrying].

12.verse: And they shall take all the utensils of the service with which they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a cloth of blue, and cover them with a covering of dolphin or porpoise skin, and shall put them on the frame [for carrying].

13.verse: And they shall take away the ashes from the altar [of burnt offering] and spread a purple cloth over it.

14.verse: And they shall put upon it all its vessels and utensils with which they minister there, the firepans, the fleshhooks or forks, the shovels, the basins, and all the vessels and utensils of the altar, and they shall spread over it all a covering of dolphin or porpoise skin, and shall put in its poles [for carrying].

15.verse: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all its furniture, as the camp sets out, after all that [is done but not before], the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them. But they shall not touch the holy things, lest they die. These are the things of the Tent of Meeting which the sons of Kohath are to carry.

16.verse: And Eleazar son of Aaron the priest shall have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the continual cereal offering, and the anointing oil, with the oversight of all the tabernacle and of all that is in it, of the sanctuary and its utensils.

17.verse: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

18.verse: [Since] the tribe of the families of the Kohathites [are only Levites and not priests], do not [by exposing them to the sin of touching the most holy things] cut them off from among the Levites.

19.verse: But deal thus with them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint them each to his work and to his burden [to be carried on the march].

20.verse: But [the Kohathites] shall not go in to see the sanctuary [the Holy Place and the Holy of Holies] or its holy things, even for an instant, lest they die.

21.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

22.verse: Take a census of the sons of Gershon, by their fathers' houses, by their families.

23.verse: From thirty years old and up to fifty years old you shall number them, all who enter for service to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

24.verse: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens [when on the march]:

25.verse: And they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the Tent of Meeting, its covering, and the covering of dolphin or porpoise skin that is on top of it, and the hanging or screen for the door of the Tent of Meeting,

26.verse: And the hangings of the court, and the hanging or screen for the entrance of the gate of the court which is around the tabernacle and the altar [of burnt offering], and their cords, and all the equipment for their service; whatever needs to be done with them, that they shall do.

27.verse: Under the direction of Aaron and his sons shall be all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all they have to carry and in all they have to do; and you shall assign to their charge all that they are to carry [on the march].

28.verse: This is the service of the families of the sons of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting; and their work shall be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the [high] priest.

29.verse: As for the sons of Merari, you shall number them by their families and their fathers' houses;

30.verse: From thirty years old up to fifty years old you shall number them, everyone who enters the service to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

31.verse: And this is what they are assigned to carry and to guard [on the march], according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting: the boards or frames of the tabernacle, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets or bases,

32.verse: And the pillars of the court round about with their sockets or bases, and pegs, and cords, with all their equipment and all their accessories for service; and you shall assign to them by name the articles which they are to carry [on the march].

33.verse: This is the work of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their tasks in the Tent of Meeting, under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the [high] priest.

34.verse: And Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families and their fathers' houses,

35.verse: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who enters the service to do the work of the Tent of Meeting;

36.verse: And those who were numbered of them by their families were 2,750.

37.verse: These were numbered of the families of the Kohathites, all who did service in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the command of the Lord through Moses.

38.verse: And those that were numbered of the sons of Gershon, by their families, and by their fathers' houses,

39.verse: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service to do the work of the Tent of Meeting,

40.verse: Those who were enrolled of them, by their families, by their fathers' houses, were 2,630.

41.verse: These were numbered of the families of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered as the Lord commanded.

42.verse: And those numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, by their families, by their fathers' houses,

43.verse: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,

44.verse: Even those who were numbered of them by their families, were 3,200.

45.verse: These are those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the command of the Lord by Moses.

46.verse: All those who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the leaders of Israel counted by their families and by their fathers' houses,

47.verse: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who could enter to do the work of service and of burden bearing in the Tent of Meeting,

48.verse: Those that were numbered of them were 8,580.

49.verse: According to the command of the Lord through Moses, they were assigned each to his work of serving and carrying. Thus they were numbered by him, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

1.verse: THE LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: Command the Israelites that they put outside the camp every leper and everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is defiled by [coming in contact with] the dead.

3.verse: Both male and female you shall put out; without the camp you shall put them, that they may not defile their camp, in the midst of which I dwell.

4.verse: The Israelites did so, and put them outside the camp; as the Lord said to Moses, so the Israelites did.

5.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

6.verse: Say to the Israelites, When a man or woman commits any sin that men commit by breaking faith with the Lord, and that person is guilty,

7.verse: Then he shall confess the sin which he has committed, and he shall make restitution for his wrong in full, and add a fifth to it, and give it to him whom he has wronged.

8.verse: But if the man [wronged] has no kinsman to whom the restitution may be made, let it be given to the Lord for the priest, besides the ram of atonement with which atonement shall be made for the offender.

9.verse: And every offering of all the holy things of the Israelites which they bring to the priest shall be his.

10.verse: And every man's hallowed things shall be the priest's; whatever any man gives the priest shall be his.

11.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

12.verse: Say to the Israelites, If any man's wife goes astray and commits an offense of guilt against him,

13.verse: And a man lies with her carnally, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and it is kept secret though she is defiled, and there is no witness against her nor was she taken in the act,

14.verse: And if the spirit of jealousy comes upon him and he is jealous and suspicious of his wife who has defiled herself--or if the spirit of jealousy comes upon him and he is jealous and suspicious of his wife though she has not defiled herself--

15.verse: Then shall the man bring his wife to the priest, and he shall bring the offering required of her, a tenth of an ephah of barley meal; but he shall pour no oil upon it nor put frankincense on it [symbols of favor and joy], for it is a cereal offering of jealousy and suspicion, a memorial offering bringing iniquity to remembrance.

16.verse: And the priest shall bring her near and set her before the Lord.

17.verse: And the priest shall take holy water [probably from the sacred laver] in an earthen vessel and take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it in the water.

18.verse: And the priest shall set the woman before the Lord, and let the hair of the woman's head hang loose, and put the meal offering of remembrance in her hands, which is the jealousy and suspicion offering. And the priest shall have in his hand the water of bitterness that brings the curse.

19.verse: Then the priest shall make her take an oath, and say to the woman, If no man has lain with you and if you have not gone astray to uncleanness with another instead of your husband, then be free from any effect of this water of bitterness which brings the curse.

20.verse: But if you have gone astray and you are defiled, some man having lain with you beside your husband,

21.verse: Then the priest shall make the woman take the oath of the curse, and say to the woman, The Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people when the Lord makes your thigh fall away and your body swell.

22.verse: May this water that brings the curse go into your bowels and make your body swell and your thigh fall away. And the woman shall say, So let it be, so let it be.

23.verse: The priest shall then write these curses in a book and shall wash them off into the water of bitterness;

24.verse: And he shall cause the woman to drink the water of bitterness that brings the curse, and the water that brings the curse shall enter into her [to try her] bitterly.

25.verse: Then the priest shall take the cereal offering of jealousy and suspicion out of the woman's hand and shall wave the offering before the Lord and offer it upon the altar.

26.verse: And the priest shall take a handful of the cereal offering as the memorial portion of it and burn it on the altar, and afterward shall cause the woman to drink the water.

27.verse: And when he has made her drink the water, then if she is defiled and has committed a trespass against her husband, the curse water which she drank shall be bitterness and cause her body to swell and her thigh to fall away, and the woman shall be a curse among her people.

28.verse: But if the woman is not defiled and is clean, then she shall be free [from the curse] and be able to have children.

29.verse: This is the law of jealousy and suspicion when a wife goes aside to another instead of her husband and is defiled,

30.verse: Or when the spirit of jealousy and suspicion comes upon a man and he is jealous and suspicious of his wife; then shall he set the woman before the Lord, and the priest shall execute on her all this law.

31.verse: The [husband] shall be free from iniquity and guilt, and that woman [if guilty] shall bear her iniquity.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Say to the Israelites, When either a man or a woman shall make a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, that is, one separated and consecrated to the Lord,

3.verse: He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink; he shall drink no vinegar of wine or of strong drink, and shall drink no grape juice, or eat grapes, fresh or dried.

4.verse: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing produced from the grapevine, not even the seeds or the skins.

5.verse: All the days of the vow of his separation and abstinence there shall no razor come upon his head. Until the time is completed for which he separates himself to the Lord, he shall be holy, and shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long.

6.verse: All the days that he separates himself to the Lord he shall not go near a dead body.

7.verse: He shall not make himself unclean for his father, mother, brother, or sister, when they die, because his separation and abstinence to his God is upon his head.

8.verse: All the days of his separation and abstinence he is holy to the Lord.

9.verse: And if any man dies very suddenly beside him, and he has defiled his consecrated head, then he shall shave his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day shall he shave it.

10.verse: On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest to the door of the Tent of Meeting,

11.verse: And the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering and make atonement for him because he sinned by reason of the dead body. He shall consecrate his head the same day,

12.verse: And he shall consecrate and separate himself to the Lord for the days of his separation and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a trespass or guilt offering; but the previous days shall be void and lost, because his separation was defiled.

13.verse: And this is the law of the Nazirite when the days of his separation and abstinence are fulfilled. He shall be brought to the door of the Tent of Meeting,

14.verse: And he shall offer his gift to the Lord, one he-lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb a year old without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for a peace offering,

15.verse: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread spread with oil, and their cereal offering, and their drink offering.

16.verse: And the priest shall present them before the Lord and shall offer the person's sin offering and his burnt offering.

17.verse: And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offering to the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread; the priest shall offer also its cereal offering and its drink offering.

18.verse: And the Nazirite shall shave his consecrated head at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall take the hair and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.

19.verse: And the priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer and shall put them upon the hands of the Nazirite, after he has shaven the hair of his separation and abstinence.

20.verse: And the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the Lord; they are a holy portion for the priest, with the breast that is waved and the thigh or shoulder that is offered; and after that the Nazirite may drink wine.

21.verse: This is the law for the Nazirite who has made a vow. His offering to the Lord, besides what else he is able to afford, shall be according to the vow which he has vowed; so shall he do according to the law for his separation and abstinence [as a Nazirite].

22.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

23.verse: Say to Aaron and his sons, This is the way you shall bless the Israelites. Say to them,

24.verse: The Lord bless you and watch, guard, and keep you;

25.verse: The Lord make His face to shine upon and enlighten you and be gracious (kind, merciful, and giving favor) to you;

26.verse: The Lord lift up His [approving] countenance upon you and give you peace (tranquility of heart and life continually).

27.verse: And they shall put My name upon the Israelites, and I will bless them.

1.verse: ON THE day that Moses had fully completed setting up the tabernacle and had anointed and consecrated it and all its furniture, and the altar and all its utensils, and had anointed and set them apart for holy use,

2.verse: The princes or leaders of Israel, heads of their fathers' houses, made offerings. These were the leaders of the tribes and were over those who were numbered.

3.verse: And they brought their offering before the Lord, six covered wagons and twelve oxen; a wagon for each two of the princes or leaders and an ox for each one; and they brought them before the tabernacle.

4.verse: Then the Lord said to Moses,

5.verse: Accept the things from them, that they may be used in doing the service of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.

6.verse: So Moses took the wagons and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.

7.verse: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service;

8.verse: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the supervision of Ithamar son of Aaron, the [high] priest.

9.verse: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because they were assigned the care of the sanctuary and the holy things which had to be carried on their shoulders.

10.verse: And the princes or leaders offered sacrifices for the dedication of the altar [of burnt offering] on the day that it was anointed; and they offered their sacrifice before the altar.

11.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, They shall offer their offerings, each prince or leader on his day, for the dedication of the altar.

12.verse: He who offered his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.

13.verse: And his offering was one silver platter, the weight of which was 130 shekels, one silver basin of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a cereal offering;

14.verse: One golden bowl of ten shekels, full of incense;

15.verse: One young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

16.verse: One male goat for a sin offering;

17.verse: And for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.

18.verse: The second day Nethanel son of Zuar, leader [of the tribe] of Issachar, offered.

19.verse: He gave for his offering one silver platter, the weight of which was 130 shekels, one silver basin of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a cereal offering;

20.verse: One golden bowl of ten shekels, full of incense;

21.verse: One young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

22.verse: One male goat for a sin offering;

23.verse: And for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.

24.verse: The third day Eliab son of Helon, leader of the sons of Zebulun, offered.

25.verse: His offering was one silver platter, the weight of which was 130 shekels, one silver basin of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a cereal offering;

29.verse: And for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab son of Helon.

84.verse: This was the dedication offering for the altar [of burnt offering] from the leaders of Israel on the day when it was anointed: twelve platters of silver, twelve silver basins, twelve golden bowls;

85.verse: Each platter of silver weighing 130 shekels, each basin seventy; all the silver vessels weighed 2,400 shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

86.verse: The twelve golden bowls full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, after the shekel of the sanctuary, all the gold of the bowls being 120 shekels.

87.verse: All the oxen for the burnt offering were twelve bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs a year old twelve, together with their cereal offering; and the male goats for a sin offering twelve.

88.verse: And all the oxen for the sacrifice of the peace offerings were twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, the male lambs a year old sixty. This was the dedication of the altar [of burnt offering] after it was anointed.

89.verse: And when Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was upon the ark of the Testimony from between the two cherubim; and He spoke to [Moses].

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Say to Aaron, When you set up and light the lamps, the seven lamps shall be made to give light in front of the lampstand.

3.verse: And Aaron did so; he lighted the lamps of the lampstand to give light in front of it, as the Lord commanded Moses.

4.verse: And this was the workmanship of the candlestick: beaten or turned gold, beaten work [of gold] from its base to its flowers; according to the pattern which the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.

5.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

6.verse: Take the Levites from among the Israelites and cleanse them.

7.verse: And thus you shall do to them to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of purification [water to be used in case of sin] upon them, and let them pass a razor over all their flesh and wash their clothes and cleanse themselves.

8.verse: Then let them take a young bull and its cereal offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and another young bull you shall take for a sin offering.

9.verse: You shall present the Levites before the Tent of Meeting, and you shall assemble the whole Israelite congregation.

10.verse: And you shall present the Levites before the Lord, and the Israelites shall put their hands upon the Levites,

11.verse: And Aaron shall offer the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the Israelites and on their behalf, that they may do the service of the Lord.

12.verse: Then the Levites shall lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to the Lord, to make atonement for the Levites.

13.verse: And you shall present the Levites before Aaron and his sons and offer them as a wave offering to the Lord.

14.verse: Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the Israelites, and the Levites shall be Mine [in a very special sense].

15.verse: And after that the Levites shall go in to do service at the Tent of Meeting, when you have cleansed them and offered them as a wave offering.

16.verse: For they are wholly given to Me from among the Israelites; instead of all who open the womb, the firstborn of all the Israelites, I have taken the Levites for Myself.

17.verse: For all the firstborn of the Israelites are Mine, both of man and beast; on the day that I smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt [not of Israel], I consecrated them and set them apart for Myself.

18.verse: And I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn of the Israelites.

19.verse: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the Israelites to do the service of the Israelites at the Tent of Meeting and to make atonement for them, that there may be no plague among the Israelites if they should come near the sanctuary.

20.verse: So Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the Israelites did thus to the Levites; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses concerning [them], so did the Israelites to them.

21.verse: The Levites cleansed and purified themselves and they washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them as a wave offering before the Lord and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.

22.verse: And after that the Levites went in to do their service in the Tent of Meeting with the attendance of Aaron and his sons; as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did they to them.

23.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

24.verse: This is what applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall go in to perform the work of the service of the Tent of Meeting,

25.verse: And at the age of fifty years, they shall retire from the warfare of the service and serve no more,

26.verse: But shall help their brethren in the Tent of Meeting [attend to protecting the sacred things from being profaned], but shall do no regular or heavy service. Thus shall you direct the Levites in regard to their duties.

1.verse: THE LORD said to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt,

2.verse: Let the Israelites keep the Passover at its appointed time.

3.verse: On the fourteenth day of this month in the evening, you shall keep it at its appointed time; according to all its statutes and ordinances you shall keep it.

4.verse: So Moses told the Israelites they should keep the Passover.

5.verse: And they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month in the evening in the Wilderness of Sinai; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.

6.verse: And there were certain men who were defiled by touching the dead body of a man, so they could not keep the Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.

7.verse: Those men said to [Moses], We are defiled by touching the dead body. Why are we prevented from offering the Lord's offering at its appointed time among the Israelites?

8.verse: And Moses said to them, Stand still, and I will hear what the Lord will command concerning you.

9.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

10.verse: Say to the Israelites, If any man of you or of your posterity shall be unclean by reason of touching a dead body or is far off on a journey, still he shall keep the Passover to the Lord.

11.verse: On the fourteenth day of the second month in the evening they shall keep it, and eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

12.verse: They shall leave none of it until the morning nor break any bone of it; according to all the statutes for the Passover they shall keep it.

13.verse: But the man who is clean and is not on a journey, yet does not keep the Passover, that person shall be cut off from among his people because he did not bring the Lord's offering at its appointed time; that man shall bear [the penalty of] his sin.

14.verse: And if a stranger sojourns among you and will keep the Passover to the Lord, according to [its] statutes and its ordinances, so shall he do; you shall have one statute both for the temporary resident and for him who was born in the land.

15.verse: And on the day that the tabernacle was erected, the cloud [of God's presence] covered the tabernacle, that is, the Tent of the Testimony; and at evening it was over the tabernacle, having the appearance of [a pillar of] fire until the morning.

16.verse: So it was constantly; the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

17.verse: Whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Tent, after that the Israelites journeyed; and in the place where the cloud rested, there the Israelites encamped.

18.verse: At the Lord's command the Israelites journeyed, and at [His] command they encamped. As long as the cloud rested upon the tabernacle they remained encamped.

19.verse: Even when the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle many days, the Israelites kept the Lord's charge and did not set out.

20.verse: And sometimes the cloud was only a few days upon the tabernacle, but according to the command of the Lord they remained encamped, and at His command they journeyed.

21.verse: And sometimes the cloud remained [over the tabernacle] from evening only until morning, but when the cloud was taken up, they journeyed; whether it was taken up by day or by night, they journeyed.

22.verse: Whether it was two days or a month or a longer time that the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle, dwelling on it, the Israelites remained encamped; but when it was taken up, they journeyed.

23.verse: At the command of the Lord they remained encamped, and at [His] command they journeyed; they kept the charge of the Lord, at the command of the Lord through Moses.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Make two trumpets of silver; of hammered or turned work you shall make them, that you may use them to call the congregation and for breaking camp.

3.verse: When they both are blown, all the congregation shall assemble before you at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

4.verse: And if one blast on a single trumpet is blown, then the princes or leaders, heads of the tribes of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.

5.verse: When you blow an alarm, the camps on the east side [of the tabernacle] shall set out.

6.verse: When you blow an alarm the second time, then the camps on the south side shall set out. An alarm shall be blown whenever they are to set out on their journeys.

7.verse: When the congregation is to be assembled, you shall blow [the trumpets in short, sharp tones], but not the blast of an alarm.

8.verse: And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets, and the trumpets shall be to you for a perpetual statute throughout your generations.

9.verse: When you go to war in your land against the enemy that oppresses you, then blow an alarm with the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the Lord your God, and you shall be saved from your enemies.

10.verse: Also in the day of rejoicing, and in your set feasts, and at the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your peace offerings; thus they may be a remembrance before your God. I am the Lord your God.

11.verse: On the twentieth day of the second month in the second year [since leaving Egypt], the cloud [of the Lord's presence] was taken up from over the tabernacle of the Testimony,

12.verse: And the Israelites took their journey by stages out of the Wilderness of Sinai, and the [guiding] cloud rested in the Wilderness of Paran.

13.verse: When the journey was to begin, at the command of the Lord through Moses,

14.verse: In the first place went the standard of the camp of the sons of Judah by their companies; and over their host was Nahshon son of Amminadab.

15.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Issachar was Nethanel son of Zuar.

16.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun was Eliab son of Helon.

17.verse: When the tabernacle was taken down, the sons of Gershon and Merari, bearing [it] on their shoulders, set out.

18.verse: The standard of the camp of Reuben set forward by their companies; and over Reuben's host was Elizur son of Shedeur.

19.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Simeon was Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

20.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Gad was Eliasaph son of Deuel.

21.verse: Then the Kohathites set forward, bearing the holy things, and the tabernacle was set up before they arrived.

22.verse: And the standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim set forward according to their companies; and over Ephraim's host was Elishama son of Ammihud.

23.verse: Over the host of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh was Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

24.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin was Abidan son of Gideoni.

25.verse: Then the standard of the camp of the sons of Dan, which was the rear guard of all the camps, set forward according to their companies; and over Dan's host was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

26.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Asher was Pagiel son of Ochran.

27.verse: And over the host of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali was Ahira son of Enan.

28.verse: This was the Israelites' order of march by their hosts when they set out.

29.verse: And Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses' father-in-law, We are journeying to the place of which the Lord said, I will give it to you. Come with us, and we will do you good, for the Lord has promised good concerning Israel.

30.verse: And Hobab said to him, I will not go; I will depart to my own land and to my family.

31.verse: And Moses said, Do not leave us, I pray you; for you know how we are to encamp in the wilderness, and you will serve as eyes for us.

32.verse: And if you will go with us, it shall be that whatever good the Lord does to us, the same we will do to you.

33.verse: They departed from the mountain of the Lord [Mount Sinai] three days' journey; and the ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them during the three days' journey to seek out a resting-place for them.

34.verse: The cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they went forward from the camp.

35.verse: Whenever the ark set out, Moses said, Rise up, Lord; let Your enemies be scattered; and let those who hate You flee before You.

36.verse: And when it rested, he said, Return, O Lord, to the ten thousand thousands in Israel.

1.verse: AND THE people grumbled and deplored their hardships, which was evil in the ears of the Lord, and when the Lord heard it, His anger was kindled; and the fire of the Lord burned among them and devoured those in the outlying parts of the camp.

2.verse: The people cried to Moses, and when Moses prayed to the Lord, the fire subsided.

3.verse: He called the name of the place Taberah [burning], because the fire of the Lord burned among them.

4.verse: And the mixed multitude among them [the rabble who followed Israel from Egypt] began to lust greatly [for familiar and dainty food], and the Israelites wept again and said, Who will give us meat to eat?

5.verse: We remember the fish we ate freely in Egypt and without cost, the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic.

6.verse: But now our soul (our strength) is dried up; there is nothing at all [in the way of food] to be seen but this manna.

7.verse: The manna was like coriander seed and its appearance was like that of bdellium [perhaps a precious stone].

8.verse: The people went about and gathered it, and ground it in mills or beat it in mortars, and boiled it in pots, and made cakes of it; and it tasted like cakes baked with fresh oil.

9.verse: And when the dew fell on the camp in the night, the manna fell with it.

10.verse: And Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, every man at the door of his tent; and the anger of the Lord blazed hotly, and in the eyes of Moses it was evil.

11.verse: And Moses said to the Lord, Why have You dealt ill with Your servants? And why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You lay the burden of all this people on me?

12.verse: Have I conceived all this people? Have I brought them forth, that You should say to me, Carry them in your bosom, as a nursing father carries the sucking child, to the land which You swore to their fathers [to give them]?

13.verse: Where should I get meat to give to all these people? For they weep before me and say, Give us meat, that we may eat.

14.verse: I am not able to carry all these people alone, because the burden is too heavy for me.

15.verse: And if this is the way You deal with me, kill me, I pray You, at once, and be granting me a favor and let me not see my wretchedness [in the failure of all my efforts].

16.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, Gather for Me seventy men of the elders of Israel whom you know to be the elders of the people and officers over them; and bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them stand there with you.

17.verse: And I will come down and talk with you there; and I will take of the Spirit which is upon you and will put It upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, so that you may not have to bear it yourself alone.

18.verse: And say to the people, Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat; for you have wept in the hearing of the Lord, saying, Who will give us meat to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt. Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you shall eat.

19.verse: You shall not eat one day, or two, or five, or ten, or twenty days,

20.verse: But a whole month--until [you are satiated and vomit it up violently and] it comes out at your nostrils and is disgusting to you--because you have rejected and despised the Lord Who is among you, and have wept before Him, saying, Why did we come out of Egypt?

21.verse: But Moses said, The people among whom I am are 600,000 footmen [besides all the women and children], and You have said, I will give them meat, that they may eat a whole month!

22.verse: Shall flocks and herds be killed to suffice them? Or shall all the fish of the sea be collected to satisfy them?

23.verse: The Lord said to Moses, Has the Lord's hand (His ability and power) become short (thwarted and inadequate)? You shall see now whether My word shall come to pass for you or not.

24.verse: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord, and he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people and set them round about the Tent.

25.verse: And the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was upon him and put It upon the seventy elders; and when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied [sounding forth the praises of God and declaring His will]. Then they did so no more.

26.verse: But there remained two men in the camp named Eldad and Medad. The Spirit rested upon them, and they were of those who were selected and listed, yet they did not go out to the Tent [as told to do], but they prophesied in the camp.

27.verse: And a young man ran to Moses and said, Eldad and Medad are prophesying [sounding forth the praises of God and declaring His will] in the camp.

28.verse: Joshua son of Nun, the minister of Moses, one of his chosen men, said, My lord Moses, forbid them!

29.verse: But Moses said to him, Are you envious or jealous for my sake? Would that all the Lord's people were prophets and that the Lord would put His Spirit upon them!

30.verse: And Moses went back into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

31.verse: And there went forth a wind from the Lord and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall [so they flew low] beside the camp, about a day's journey on this side and on the other side, all around the camp, about two cubits above the ground.

32.verse: And the people rose all that day and all night and all the next day and caught and gathered the quails. He who gathered least gathered ten homers; and they spread them out for themselves round about the camp [to cure them by drying].

33.verse: While the meat was yet between their teeth, before it was consumed, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord smote them with a very great plague.

34.verse: That place was called Kibroth-hattaavah [the graves of sensuous desire], because there they buried the people who lusted, whose physical appetite caused them to sin.

35.verse: The Israelites journeyed from Kibroth-hattaavah to Hazeroth, where they remained.

1.verse: NOW MIRIAM and Aaron talked against Moses [their brother] because of his Cushite wife, for he had married a Cushite woman.

2.verse: And they said, Has the Lord indeed spoken only by Moses? Has He not spoken also by us? And the Lord heard it.

3.verse: Now the man Moses was very meek (gentle, kind, and humble) or above all the men on the face of the earth.

4.verse: Suddenly the Lord said to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, Come out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting. And the three of them came out.

5.verse: The Lord came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the Tent door and called Aaron and Miriam, and they came forward.

6.verse: And He said, Hear now My words: If there is a prophet among you, I the Lord make Myself known to him in a vision and speak to him in a dream.

7.verse: But not so with My servant Moses; he is entrusted and faithful in all My house.

8.verse: With him I speak mouth to mouth [directly], clearly and not in dark speeches; and he beholds the form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against My servant Moses?

9.verse: And the anger of the Lord was kindled against them, and He departed.

10.verse: And when the cloud departed from over the Tent, behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. And Aaron looked at Miriam, and, behold, she was leprous!

11.verse: And Aaron said to Moses, Oh, my lord, I plead with you, lay not the sin upon us in which we have done foolishly and in which we have sinned.

12.verse: Let her not be as one dead, already half decomposed when he comes out of his mother's womb.

13.verse: And Moses cried to the Lord, saying, Heal her now, O God, I beseech You!

14.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, If her father had but spit in her face, should she not be ashamed for seven days? Let her be shut up outside the camp for seven days, and after that let her be brought in again.

15.verse: So Miriam was shut up without the camp for seven days, and the people did not journey on until Miriam was brought in again.

16.verse: Afterward [they] removed from Hazeroth and encamped in the Wilderness of Paran.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Send men to explore and scout out [for yourselves] the land of Canaan, which I give to the Israelites. From each tribe of their fathers you shall send a man, every one a leader or head among them.

3.verse: So Moses by the command of the Lord sent scouts from the Wilderness of Paran, all of them men who were heads of the Israelites.

4.verse: These were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;

5.verse: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;

6.verse: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

7.verse: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;

8.verse: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea [that is, Joshua] son of Nun;

9.verse: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;

10.verse: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;

11.verse: Of the tribe of Joseph, that is, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi;

12.verse: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;

13.verse: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;

14.verse: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;

15.verse: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.

16.verse: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to explore and scout out the land. And Moses called Hoshea son of Nun, Joshua.

17.verse: Moses sent them to scout out the land of Canaan, and said to them, Get up this way by the South (the Negeb) and go up into the hill country,

18.verse: And see what the land is and whether the people who dwell there are strong or weak, few or many,

19.verse: And whether the land they live in is good or bad, and whether the cities they dwell in are camps or strongholds,

20.verse: And what the land is, whether it is fat or lean, whether there is timber on it or not. And be of good courage and bring some of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the first ripe grapes.

21.verse: So they went up and scouted through the land from the Wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to the entrance of Hamath.

22.verse: And then went up into the South (the Negeb) and came to Hebron; and Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai [probably three tribes of] the sons of Anak were there. (Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

23.verse: And they came to the Valley of Eshcol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they carried it on a pole between two [of them]; they brought also some pomegranates and figs.

24.verse: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol [cluster] because of the cluster which the Israelites cut down there.

25.verse: And they returned from scouting out the land after forty days.

26.verse: They came to Moses and Aaron and to all the Israelite congregation in the Wilderness of Paran at Kadesh, and brought them word, and showed them the land's fruit.

27.verse: They told Moses, We came to the land to which you sent us; surely it flows with milk and honey. This is its fruit.

28.verse: But the people who dwell there are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, there we saw the sons of Anak [of great stature and courage].

29.verse: Amalek dwells in the land of the South (the Negeb); the Hittite, the Jebusite, and the Amorite dwell in the hill country; and the Canaanite dwells by the sea and along by the side of the Jordan [River].

30.verse: Caleb quieted the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once and possess it; we are well able to conquer it.

31.verse: But his fellow scouts said, We are not able to go up against the people [of Canaan], for they are stronger than we are.

32.verse: So they brought the Israelites an evil report of the land which they had scouted out, saying, The land through which we went to spy it out is a land that devours its inhabitants. And all the people that we saw in it are men of great stature.

33.verse: There we saw the Nephilim [or giants], the sons of Anak, who come from the giants; and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.

1.verse: AND ALL the congregation cried out with a loud voice, and [they] wept that night.

2.verse: All the Israelites grumbled and deplored their situation, accusing Moses and Aaron, to whom the whole congregation said, Would that we had died in Egypt! Or that we had died in this wilderness!

3.verse: Why does the Lord bring us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and little ones will be a prey. Is it not better for us to return to Egypt?

4.verse: And they said one to another, Let us choose a captain and return to Egypt.

5.verse: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of Israelites.

6.verse: And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among the scouts who had searched the land, rent their clothes,

7.verse: And they said to all the company of Israelites, The land through which we passed as scouts is an exceedingly good land.

8.verse: If the Lord delights in us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.

9.verse: Only do not rebel against the Lord, neither fear the people of the land, for they are bread for us. Their defense and the shadow [of protection] is removed from over them, but the Lord is with us. Fear them not.

10.verse: But all the congregation said to stone [Joshua and Caleb] with stones. But the glory of the Lord appeared at the Tent of Meeting before all the Israelites.

11.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, How long will this people provoke (spurn, despise) Me? And how long will it be before they believe Me [trusting in, relying on, clinging to Me], for all the signs which I have performed among them?

12.verse: I will smite them with the pestilence and disinherit them, and will make of you [Moses] a nation greater and mightier than they.

13.verse: But Moses said to the Lord, Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for You brought up this people in Your might from among them.

14.verse: And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, Lord, are in the midst of this people [of Israel], that You, Lord, are seen face to face, and that Your cloud stands over them, and that You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.

15.verse: Now if You kill all this people as one man, then the nations that have heard Your fame will say,

16.verse: Because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the land which He swore to give to them, therefore He has slain them in the wilderness.

17.verse: And now, I pray You, let the power of my Lord be great, as You have promised, saying,

18.verse: The Lord is long-suffering and slow to anger, and abundant in mercy and loving-kindness, forgiving iniquity and transgression; but He will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, upon the third and fourth generation.

19.verse: Pardon, I pray You, the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of Your mercy and loving-kindness, just as You have forgiven [them] from Egypt until now.

20.verse: And the Lord said, I have pardoned according to your word.

21.verse: But truly as I live and as all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the Lord,

22.verse: Because all those men who have seen My glory and My [miraculous] signs which I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tested and proved Me these ten times and have not heeded My voice,

23.verse: Surely they shall not see the land which I swore to give to their fathers; nor shall any who provoked (spurned, despised) Me see it.

24.verse: But My servant Caleb, because he has a different spirit and has followed Me fully, I will bring into the land into which he went, and his descendants shall possess it.

25.verse: Now because the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the valley, tomorrow turn and go into the wilderness by way of the Red Sea.

26.verse: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

27.verse: How long will this evil congregation murmur against Me? I have heard the complaints the Israelites murmur against Me.

28.verse: Tell them, As I live, says the Lord, what you have said in My hearing I will do to you:

29.verse: Your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness--of all who were numbered of you, from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against Me,

30.verse: Surely none shall come into the land in which I swore to make you dwell, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

31.verse: But your little ones whom you said would be a prey, them will I bring in and they shall know the land which you have despised and rejected.

32.verse: But as for you, your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness.

33.verse: And your children shall be wanderers and shepherds in the wilderness for forty years and shall suffer for your whoredoms (your infidelity to your espoused God), until your corpses are consumed in the wilderness.

34.verse: After the number of the days in which you spied out the land [of Canaan], even forty days, for each day a year shall you bear and suffer for your iniquities, even for forty years, and you shall know My displeasure [the revoking of My promise and My estrangement].

35.verse: I the Lord have spoken; surely this will I do to all this evil congregation who is gathered together against Me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed [by war, disease, plagues], and here they shall die.

36.verse: And the men whom Moses sent to search the land, who returned and made all the congregation grumble and complain against him by bringing back a slanderous report of the land,

37.verse: Even those men who brought the evil report of the land died by a plague before the Lord.

38.verse: But Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among the men who went to search the land, lived still.

39.verse: Moses told [the Lord's] words to all the Israelites, and [they] mourned greatly.

40.verse: And they rose early in the morning and went up to the top of the mountain, saying, Behold, we are here, and we intend to go up to the place which the Lord has promised, for we have sinned.

41.verse: But Moses said, Why now do you transgress the command of the Lord [to turn back by way of the Red Sea], since it will not succeed?

42.verse: Go not up, for the Lord is not among you, that you be not struck down before your enemies.

43.verse: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you shall fall by the sword. Because you have turned away from following after the Lord, therefore the Lord will not be with you.

44.verse: But they presumed to go up to the heights of the hill country; however, neither the ark of the covenant of the Lord nor Moses departed out of the camp.

45.verse: Then the Amalekites came down and the Canaanites who dwelt in that hill country and smote the Israelites and beat them back, even as far as Hormah.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Say to the Israelites, When you come into the land where you are to live, which I am giving you,

3.verse: And will make an offering by fire to the Lord from the herd or from the flock, a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a special vow or as a freewill offering or in your set feasts, to make a pleasant and soothing fragrance to the Lord,

4.verse: Then shall he who brings his offering to the Lord bring a cereal offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a fourth of a hin of oil.

5.verse: And a fourth of a hin of wine for the drink offering you shall prepare with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.

6.verse: Or for a ram you shall prepare for a cereal offering two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil.

7.verse: And for the drink offering you shall offer a third of a hin of wine, for a sweet and pleasing odor to the Lord.

8.verse: And when you prepare a bull for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice, in fulfilling a special vow or peace offering to the Lord,

9.verse: Then shall one offer with the bull a cereal offering of three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil.

10.verse: And you shall bring for the drink offering half a hin of wine for an offering made by fire, of a pleasant and soothing fragrance to the Lord.

11.verse: Thus shall it be done for each bull or for each ram, or for each of the male lambs or of the kids.

12.verse: According to the number that you shall prepare, so shall you do to everyone according to their number.

13.verse: All who are native-born shall do these things in this way in bringing an offering made by fire of a sweet and pleasant odor to the Lord.

14.verse: And if a stranger sojourns with you or whoever may be among you throughout your generations, and he wishes to offer an offering made by fire, of a pleasing and soothing fragrance to the Lord, as you do, so shall he do.

15.verse: There shall be one [and the same] statute [both] for you [of the congregation] and for the stranger who is a temporary resident with you, a statute forever throughout your generations: as you are, so shall the stranger be before the Lord.

16.verse: One law and one ordinance shall be for you and for the stranger who sojourns with you.

17.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

18.verse: Say to the Israelites, When you come into the land to which I am bringing you,

19.verse: Then, when you eat of the food of the land, you shall set apart a portion for a gift to the Lord [called a heave or taken-out offering].

20.verse: You shall set apart a cake made of the first of your coarse meal as a gift [to the Lord]; as an offering set apart from the threshing floor, so shall you lift it out or heave it.

21.verse: Of the first of your coarse meal you shall give to the Lord a portion for a gift throughout your generations [your heave or lifted-out offering].

22.verse: When you have erred and have not observed all these commandments which the Lord has spoken to Moses,

23.verse: Even all that the Lord has commanded you through Moses, from the day that the Lord gave commandment and onward throughout your generations,

24.verse: Then it shall be, if it was done unwittingly or in error without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bull for a burnt offering, for a pleasant and soothing fragrance to the Lord, with its cereal offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.

25.verse: And the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the Israelites, and they shall be forgiven, for it was an error and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord for their error.

26.verse: And all the congregation of the Israelites shall be forgiven and the stranger who lives temporarily among them, because all the people were involved in the error.

27.verse: And if any person sins unknowingly or unintentionally, he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering.

28.verse: And the priest shall make atonement before the Lord for the person who commits an error when he sins unknowingly or unintentionally, to make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven.

29.verse: You shall have one law for him who sins unknowingly or unintentionally, whether he is native born among the Israelites or a stranger who is sojourning among them.

30.verse: But the person who does anything [wrong] willfully and openly, whether he is native-born or a stranger, that one reproaches, reviles, and blasphemes the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from among his people [that the atonement made for them may not include him].

31.verse: Because he has despised and rejected the word of the Lord, and has broken His commandment, that person shall be utterly cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.

32.verse: While the Israelites were in the wilderness, they found a man who was gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.

33.verse: Those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation.

34.verse: They put him in custody, because it was not certain or clear what should be done to him.

35.verse: And the Lord said to Moses, The man shall surely be put to death. All the congregation shall stone him with stones without the camp.

36.verse: And all the congregation brought him without the camp and stoned him to death with stones, as the Lord commanded Moses.

37.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

38.verse: Speak to the Israelites and bid them make fringes or tassels on the corners in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and put upon the fringe of the borders or upon the tassel of each corner a cord of blue.

39.verse: And it shall be to you a fringe or tassel that you may look upon and remember all the commandments of the Lord and do them, that you may not spy out and follow after [the desires of] your own heart and your own eyes, after which you used to follow and play the harlot [spiritually, if not physically],

40.verse: That you may remember and do all My commandments and be holy to your God.

41.verse: I am the Lord your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord your God.

1.verse: NOW KORAH son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men,

2.verse: And they rose up before Moses, with certain of the Israelites, 250 princes or leaders of the congregation called to the assembly, men well known and of distinction.

3.verse: And they gathered together against Moses and Aaron, and said to them, [Enough of you!] You take too much upon yourselves, seeing that all the congregation is holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them. Why then do you lift yourselves up above the assembly of the Lord?

4.verse: And when Moses heard it, he fell upon his face.

5.verse: And he said to Korah and all his company, In the morning the Lord will show who are His and who is holy, and will cause him to come near to Him; him whom He has chosen will He cause to come near to Him.

6.verse: Do this: Take censers, Korah and all your company,

7.verse: And put fire in them and put incense upon them before the Lord tomorrow; and the man whom the Lord chooses shall be holy. You take too much upon yourselves, you sons of Levi.

8.verse: And Moses said to Korah, Hear, I pray you, you sons of Levi:

9.verse: Does it seem but a small thing to you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Himself to do the service of the tabernacle of the Lord and to stand before the congregation to minister to them,

10.verse: And that He has brought you near to Him, and all your brethren the sons of Levi with you? Would you seek the priesthood also?

11.verse: Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against the Lord. And Aaron, what is he that you murmur against him?

12.verse: And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and they said, We will not come up.

13.verse: Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to kill us in the wilderness, but you must also make yourself a prince over us?

14.verse: Moreover, you have not brought us into a land that flows with milk and honey or given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you bore out the eyes of these men? We will not come up!

15.verse: And Moses was very angry and said to the Lord, Do not respect their offering! I have not taken one donkey from them, nor have I hurt one of them.

16.verse: And Moses said to Korah, You and all your company be before the Lord tomorrow, you and they and Aaron.

17.verse: And let every man take his censer and put incense upon it and bring before the Lord every man his censer, 250 censers; you also and Aaron, each his censer.

18.verse: So they took every man his censer, and they put fire in them and laid incense upon it, and they stood at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting with Moses and Aaron.

19.verse: Then Korah assembled all the congregation against Moses and Aaron before the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of the Lord appeared to all the congregation.

20.verse: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

21.verse: Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.
