41.verse: Jair son of Manasseh took their villages and called them Havvoth-jair.

42.verse: And Nobah took Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah after his own name.

1.verse: THESE ARE the stages of the journeys of the Israelites by which they went out of the land of Egypt by their hosts under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.

2.verse: Moses recorded their starting places, as the Lord commanded, stage by stage; and these are their journeying stages from their starting places:

3.verse: They set out from Rameses on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the day after the Passover the Israelites went out [of Egypt] with a high hand and triumphantly in the sight of all the Egyptians,

4.verse: While the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn whom the Lord had struck down among them; upon their gods also the Lord executed judgments.

5.verse: The Israelites set out from Rameses and encamped in Succoth.

6.verse: And they departed from Succoth and encamped in Etham, which is at the edge of the wilderness.

7.verse: They set out from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, east of Baal-zephon, and they encamped before Migdol.

8.verse: And they journeyed from before Pi-hahiroth and passed through the midst of the [Red] Sea into the wilderness; and they went a three days' journey in the Wilderness of Etham and encamped at Marah.

9.verse: They journeyed from Marah and came to Elim; at Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they encamped there.

10.verse: They set out from Elim and encamped by the Red Sea.

11.verse: They journeyed from the Red Sea and encamped in the Wilderness of Sin.

12.verse: And they traveled on from the Wilderness of Sin and encamped at Dophkah.

13.verse: And they departed from Dophkah and encamped at Alush.

14.verse: And they set out from Alush and encamped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.

15.verse: And they departed from Rephidim and encamped in the Wilderness of Sinai.

16.verse: And they journeyed from the Wilderness of Sinai and encamped at Kibroth-hattaavah.

17.verse: And they traveled on from Kibroth-hattaavah and encamped at Hazeroth.

18.verse: And they journeyed from Hazeroth and encamped at Rithmah.

19.verse: And they departed from Rithmah and encamped at Rimmon-perez.

20.verse: And they departed from Rimmon-perez and encamped at Libnah.

21.verse: And they removed from Libnah and encamped at Rissah.

22.verse: And they journeyed from Rissah and encamped at Kehelathah.

23.verse: And they went from Kehelathah and encamped at Mount Shepher.

24.verse: And they removed from Mount Shepher and encamped at Haradah.

25.verse: And they set out from Haradah and encamped at Makheloth.

26.verse: And they removed from Makheloth and encamped at Tahath.

27.verse: And they departed from Tahath and encamped at Terah.

28.verse: And they removed from Terah and encamped at Mithkah.

29.verse: And they set out from Mithkah and encamped at Hashmonah.

30.verse: And they traveled on from Hashmonah and encamped at Moseroth.

31.verse: And they journeyed from Moseroth and pitched in Bene-jaakan.

32.verse: And they set out from Bene-jaakan and encamped at Hor-haggidgad.

33.verse: And they set out from Hor-haggidgad and encamped at Jotbathah.

34.verse: And they journeyed from Jotbathah and encamped at Abronah.

35.verse: And they traveled on from Abronah and encamped at Ezion-geber.

36.verse: And they removed from Ezion-geber and encamped in the Wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.

37.verse: And they removed from Kadesh and encamped at Mount Hor, on the edge of Edom.

38.verse: Aaron the priest went up on Mount Hor at the command of the Lord, and died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt, the first day of the fifth month.

39.verse: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.

40.verse: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the South (the Negeb) in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the Israelites.

41.verse: They set out from Mount Hor and encamped at Zalmonah.

42.verse: And they set out from Zalmonah and encamped at Punon.

43.verse: And they set out from Punon and encamped at Oboth.

44.verse: And they traveled on from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, on the border of Moab.

45.verse: And they departed from Iyim and encamped at Dibon-gad.

46.verse: And they set out from Dibon-gad and encamped in Almon-diblathaim.

47.verse: And they traveled on from Almon-diblathaim and encamped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

48.verse: And they departed from the mountains of Abarim and encamped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.

49.verse: And they encamped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.

50.verse: And the Lord said to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho,

51.verse: Tell the Israelites, When you have passed over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

52.verse: Then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you and destroy all their figured stones and all their molten images and completely demolish all their [idolatrous] high places,

53.verse: And you shall take possession of the land and dwell in it, for to you I have given the land to possess it.

54.verse: You shall inherit the land by lot according to your families; to the large tribe you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the small tribe you shall give a smaller inheritance. Wherever the lot falls to any man, that shall be his. According to the tribes of your fathers you shall inherit.

55.verse: But if you will not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those you let remain of them shall be as pricks in your eyes and as thorns in your sides, and they shall vex you in the land in which you dwell.

56.verse: And as I thought to do to them, so will I do to you.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: Command the Israelites, When you come into the land of Canaan (which is the land that shall be yours for an inheritance, the land of Canaan according to its boundaries),

3.verse: Your south side shall be from the Wilderness of Zin along the side of Edom, and your southern boundary from the end of the Salt [Dead] Sea eastward.

4.verse: Your boundary shall turn south of the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass on to Zin, and its end shall be south of Kadesh-barnea. Then it shall go on to Hazar-addar and pass on to Azmon.

5.verse: Then the boundary shall turn from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and it shall terminate at the [Mediterranean] Sea.

6.verse: For the western boundary you shall have the Great Sea and its coast.

7.verse: And this shall be your north border: from the Great Sea mark out your boundary line to Mount Hor;

8.verse: From Mount Hor you shall mark out your boundary to the entrance of Hamath, and its end shall be at Zedad;

9.verse: Then the northern boundary shall go on to Ziphron, and the end of it shall be at Hazar-enan.

10.verse: You shall mark out your eastern boundary from Hazar-enan to Shepham;

11.verse: The boundary shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and shall descend and reach to the shoulder of the Sea of Chinnereth [the Sea of Galilee] on the east;

12.verse: And the boundary shall go down to the Jordan, and the end shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land with its boundaries all around.

13.verse: Moses commanded the Israelites, This is the land you shall inherit by lot, which the Lord has commanded to give to the nine tribes and the half-tribe [of Manasseh],

14.verse: For the tribes of the sons of Reuben and of Gad by their fathers' houses have received their inheritance, and also the half-tribe of Manasseh.

15.verse: The two and a half tribes have received their inheritance east of the Jordan at Jericho, toward the sunrise.

16.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

17.verse: These are the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.

18.verse: And [with them] you shall take one head or prince of each tribe to divide the land for inheritance.

19.verse: The names of the men are: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

20.verse: Of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shemuel son of Ammihud;

21.verse: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Chislon;

22.verse: Of the tribe of the sons of Dan a leader, Bukki son of Jogli;

23.verse: Of the sons of Joseph: of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh a leader, Hanniel son of Ephod;

24.verse: And of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim a leader, Kemuel son of Shiphtan;

25.verse: And of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun a leader, Elizaphan son of Parnach;

26.verse: And of the tribe of the sons of Issachar a leader, Paltiel son of Azzan;

27.verse: And of the tribe of the sons of Asher a leader, Ahihud son of Shelomi;

28.verse: And of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali a leader, Pedahel son of Ammihud.

29.verse: These are the men whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho,

2.verse: Command the Israelites that they give to the Levites from the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and [suburb] pasturelands round about the cities' walls you shall give to the Levites also.

3.verse: They shall have the cities to dwell in and their [suburb] pasturelands shall be for their cattle, for their wealth [in flocks], and for all their beasts.

4.verse: And the pasturelands of the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall reach from the wall of the city and outward 1,000 cubits round about.

5.verse: You shall measure from the wall of the city outward on the east, south, west, and north sides 2,000 cubits, the city being in the center. This shall belong to [the Levites] as [suburb] pasturelands for their cities.

6.verse: Of the cities which you shall give to the Levites there shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the manslayer to flee into; and in addition to them you shall give forty-two cities.

7.verse: So all the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight; you shall give them with their adjacent [suburb] pasturelands.

8.verse: As for the cities, you shall give from the possession of the Israelites, from the larger tribes you shall take many and from the smaller tribes few; each tribe shall give of its cities to the Levites in proportion to its inheritance.

9.verse: And the Lord said to Moses,

10.verse: Say to the Israelites, When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

11.verse: Then you shall select cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the slayer who kills any person unintentionally and unawares may flee there.

12.verse: And the cities shall be to you for refuge from the avenger, that the manslayer may not die until he has had a fair trial before the congregation.

13.verse: And of the cities which you give there shall be your six cities for refuge.

14.verse: You shall give three cities on this [east] side of the Jordan and three cities in the land of Canaan, to be cities of refuge.

15.verse: These six cities shall be a refuge for the Israelites and for the stranger and the temporary resident among them; that anyone who kills any person unintentionally and unawares may flee there.

16.verse: But if he struck him down with an instrument of iron so that he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.

17.verse: And if he struck him down by throwing a stone, by which a person may die, and he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.

18.verse: Or if he struck him down with a weapon of wood in his hand, by which one may die, and he died, the offender is a murderer; he shall surely be put to death.

19.verse: The avenger of blood shall himself slay the murderer; when he meets him, he shall slay him.

20.verse: But if he stabbed him through hatred or hurled at him by lying in wait so that he died

21.verse: Or in enmity struck him down with his hand so that he died, he that smote him shall surely be put to death; he is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall slay the murderer when he meets him.

22.verse: But if he stabbed him suddenly without enmity or threw anything at or upon him without lying in wait

23.verse: Or with any stone with which a man may be killed, not seeing him, and threw it at him so that he died, and was not his enemy nor sought to harm him,

24.verse: Then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.

25.verse: And the congregation shall rescue the manslayer from the hand of the avenger of blood and restore him to his city of refuge to which he had fled; and he shall live in it until the high priest dies, who was anointed with the sacred oil.

26.verse: But if the slayer shall at any time come outside the limits of his city of refuge to which he had fled

27.verse: And the avenger of blood finds him outside the limits of his city of refuge and kills the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood

28.verse: Because the manslayer should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the high priest's death the manslayer shall return to the land of his possession.

29.verse: And these things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

30.verse: Whoever kills any person [intentionally], the murderer shall be put to death on the testimony of witnesses; but no one shall be put to death on the testimony of one witness.

31.verse: Moreover, you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer guilty of death; but he shall surely be put to death.

32.verse: And you shall accept no ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, so that he may return to dwell in the land before the death of the high priest.

33.verse: So you shall not pollute the land in which you live; for blood pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land for the blood shed in it, but by the blood of him who shed it.

34.verse: And you shall not defile the land in which you live, in the midst of which I dwell, for I, the Lord, dwell in the midst of the people of Israel.

1.verse: THE HEADS of the fathers' houses of the families of the sons of Gilead son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the fathers' houses of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and the leaders, the heads of the fathers' houses of the Israelites.

2.verse: They said, The Lord commanded [you] my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the Israelites; and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.

3.verse: But if they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the Israelites, then their inheritance will be taken from that of our fathers and added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they are received and belong; so it will be taken out of the lot of our inheritance.

4.verse: And when the Jubilee of the Israelites comes, then their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe to which they are received and belong; so will their inheritance be taken away from that of the tribe of our fathers.

5.verse: And Moses commanded the Israelites according to the word of the Lord, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph is right.

6.verse: This is what the Lord commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: Let them marry whom they think best; only they shall marry within the family of the tribe of their father.

7.verse: So shall no inheritance of the Israelites be transferred from tribe to tribe, for every one of the Israelites shall cling to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

8.verse: And every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the Israelites shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, so that the Israelites may each one possess the inheritance of his fathers.

9.verse: So shall no inheritance be transferred from one tribe to another, but each of the tribes of the Israelites shall cling to its own inheritance.

10.verse: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the Lord commanded Moses.

11.verse: For Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to sons of their father's brothers.

12.verse: They married into the families of the sons of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.

13.verse: These are the commandments and ordinances which the Lord commanded the Israelites through Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan [River] at Jericho.
